algorithm_technique: Frequency counting and iteration over multiples
problem_summary_simple: Count pairs (i, j) where nums1[i] is divisible by nums2[j] * k.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a frequency map for k*nums2 elements to efficiently count divisors in nums1.
key_insights: Pre-calculating multiples of k from nums2 and their frequencies is key.
Iterating through nums1 and checking for divisibility by pre-calculated multiples optimizes the search.
The constraint on values (up to 10^6) suggests a solution that doesn't involve O(N*M) brute force.
